metadata.title: CVE-2019-19830 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
_core_/plugins/medias in SPIP 3.2.x before 3.2.7 allows remoteauthenticated authors to inject content into the database.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.1.4-4~deb9u3build0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: spip package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.4-4~deb9u3build0.18.04.1').
